org.springdata.cassandra.core

Interface SaveOperation

  • All Superinterfaces:
    QueryOperation<com.datastax.driver.core.ResultSet,SaveOperation>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultSaveOperation

    public interface SaveOperation
extends QueryOperation<com.datastax.driver.core.ResultSet,SaveOperation>
    Base interface to save entity (actually update).
    Author:
    Alex Shvid

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      SaveOperation selectedFields(String... fields)
      Specifies fields that actually have to be saved.
      SaveOperation taggedFields(int... tags)
      Specifies fields that actually have to be saved.
      SaveOperation toTable(String tableName)
      Specifies table differ from entitie's table to save
      SaveOperation withTimestamp(long timestampMls)
      Specifies Timestamp (cell's timestamp in the Cassandra) in milliseconds for the saved entity in the Cassandra
      SaveOperation withTimeToLive(int ttlSeconds)
      Specifies TTL (time to live) in seconds for the saved entity in the Cassandra

      • Methods inherited from interface org.springdata.cassandra.cql.core.QueryOperation

        execute, executeAsync, executeAsync, executeNonstop, withConsistencyLevel, withExecutor, withFallbackHandler, withQueryTracing, withRetryPolicy

    • Method Detail

      • toTable

        SaveOperation toTable(String tableName)
        Specifies table differ from entitie's table to save
        Parameters:
        tableName - table name is using to save entity
        Returns:
        this

      • selectedFields

        SaveOperation selectedFields(String... fields)
        Specifies fields that actually have to be saved. By default will save all fields in the entity.
        Parameters:
        fields - Array of selected fields
        Returns:
        this

      • taggedFields

        SaveOperation taggedFields(int... tags)
        Specifies fields that actually have to be saved. By default will save all fields in the entity. The only fields that have special tag will be saved in this update. Tags are integers and usually constants that defined by @Tag annotation
        Parameters:
        tags - Array of tagged fields
        Returns:
        this

      • withTimeToLive

        SaveOperation withTimeToLive(int ttlSeconds)
        Specifies TTL (time to live) in seconds for the saved entity in the Cassandra
        Parameters:
        ttlSeconds - Time to live in seconds
        Returns:
        this

      • withTimestamp

        SaveOperation withTimestamp(long timestampMls)
        Specifies Timestamp (cell's timestamp in the Cassandra) in milliseconds for the saved entity in the Cassandra
        Parameters:
        timestamp - Timestamp in milliseconds
        Returns:
        this
